title: Analyzing Surface Relaxation in TEM-Lamella: A Method for Revealing Alloy Concentrations at Strained Semiconductor Interfaces
content: The optical and electrical characteristics of semiconductor devices are intricately influenced by the bandgaps and band offsets arising from engineered alloy concentrations in ternary semiconductors, such as AlxGa1-xN. When epitaxially grown on a substrate material, lattice mismatch induces stress at the interface, leading to localized lattice deformations known as strain. Knowledge of both the alloy concentrations and the resulting strain is essential feedback in the device manufacturing process.
